games.title: Gaia Project
games.description: Expand, research, upgrade, and settle the galaxy with one of 14 alien species.
comments: Great game. The research track is really engaging and fun. terraforming the planets is a blast and the asymmetric factions really make it repayable.
I adore this game. I know I love a game when I suck hard at it and I still love it. Come find me playing this game on BGA and kick my ass.

3D printed insert
3D printed variable turn order track with player tokens
The heaviest game in my collection, able to shatter minds and spirits of normie gamers - it's epic!

(1, 4) #players

60 €
Есть и русское и английкое (немецкое) издания + допы
it's just pretty cool to build planets colonies. also gaia project balanced really very well - every faction feels like separate game
The first game might not excite to you, but after dig the game. It become GOAT to me.
221024 Love this game! It's not a 4X (no eXtermination at all), but rather an euro with a bit of exploration.
I got this in the mail as of June 2019! I played it at BGGCon Spring 2019 and decided it's a must have.
치명적인 못생김으로도 가릴 수 없는 압도적 재미

────────────────────────────────────────────────────
'ㄱ으로 ㄴ을 얻는다, ㄴ으로 ㄷ을 얻는다...' 이 느낌이 뚜렷하게 있는 게임입니다.
격차가 마냥 크게 나지만은 않게끔 만들어여 있습니다.
테라 미스티카보다 경합성을 많이 줄여서, 저는 이쪽이 훨씬 좋습니다.
자원별 수급처가 다양해 한 눈에 파악하기 어렵습니다.
A masterfully built strategy game that will remain competitive for some time due to the plethora of strategies and factions.
Very good game, much better than TM. GP tastes like “Underwater cities” with more satisfying flow and more interaction.

games.title: Scythe
games.description: Five factions vie for dominance in a war-torn, mech-filled, dieselpunk 1920s Europe.
comments: I wasn't sure this game was for me... Somebody made me an offer I couldn't refuse. I bought it, I tried it, now I have it all!! Now, I just need to start playing with the extensions, so i can start the Fenris compaign.
Absolute masterpiece of a game.

If you like Catan and you like Civ, you'll like Scythe.

Every choice feels like a good choice, but they're not all optimal. You have to plan out your turns several turns in advance. It can be a very long game with higher player counts. But it's a very good game.

Ontslag 2023
Materiaal compleet
Spel niet compleet, mist veel promomateriaal en expansions
Inclusief solo
Niet sleeven
I've played this game more than most (aside from Targi and Onitama) and its community is amongst the best in gaming (IMHO).
The base game faction design, both player/mech powers and the starting territories, is not very balanced to the point where it seems kinda unfair.
Art is nice, concept is interesting, but the mechanics aren’t anything to write home about.

One of my favorite games of all time.  Huge learning curve but worth the effort.  No need for expansions, though I own all of them, base game is amazing.  Buy the larger player board, it is a must.  This could come standard with the game.

Incredible strategy game with interesting action selection and engaging area control. My only real complaint is that it can be difficult to understand what each faction should be pushing for and it's far too easy to over diversify.
Super blinged out version with all content and tons of upgrades and insert
The randomness of the objective and encounter cards, balancing issues and the basic shitty combat cant redeem the player boards, theme or the map interactions.

games.title: Frosthaven
games.description: Adventure in the frozen north and build up your outpost throughout an epic campaign.
comments:
Koop
(Eigenständiges Grundspiel
Erweiterbar durch Gloomhaven und Pranken des Löwen)

(Markus)
Played 20+ scenarios so far.  A few of the scenario rules are a little too complex for their own good, but overall a big step up from Gloomhaven (which was already a very fun, if flawed, game).

The puzzlebook made me dislike this game.
I want to play the game, with the characters... the cards.. the items. Not spend my evenings solving puzzles. Trying to do TOO MUCH.

Al for mye lesing, søvner før enn er halveis.
Synes den er Dårlig balanser.
Til tider så tørt at enn trenger glidemiddel for og ikke få brannsår ved flytting

Amazing game. Really love mechanics and character progression. Only thing I don't like is the outpost phase, which can be boring, and the puzzles, which are impossible and keep me away of the real fun stuff: battle

games.title: Pandemic Legacy: Season 1
games.description: Mutating diseases are spreading around the world - can your team save humanity?
comments:
Game completed, final score 591.

Would like to play again as solo.
A phenomenal, life-changingly brilliant board game. I have, and will continue to, recommend it to everyone.
瘟疫危機︰承傳 第一季 2-4人 60分鐘 (2.83)

Artwork 7
Fun 9
Game progression vs. Time 8
Mechanics 9
Packaging size 8
Quality 9
Replay appeal 8
Set-up time vs. playing time 8
Theme 10
-----------------
Rate 8.44
==========
Completed during the 2020 Covid-19 pandemic
Own used copy with Mom & Dale, and Ashtyn has a copy that we played.

This is the 1st legacy game I bought and played. I rated this game 9 after a few plays, but it goes down for me with each play. Every month feels almost the same and gathering a set of cards is not a mechanic which me and my friends are fans of. It is still much better than regular Pandemic.
Finished playthrough - can serve as basic pandemic
All the fun of Pandemic plus a narrative that takes place over 12-24 play sessions, AND characters and a board that develop along with the story? Yes, please!
Played with wife during the pandemic. Such a cool experience!

games.title: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition
games.description: Build an intergalactic empire through trade, research, conquest and grand politics.
comments: Experience it at least once
Can't say anything but wonderful things about this ridiculously epic experience
It's the game where I play until dawn and think it's only midnight. I love this game; the turns are structured so that everyone can take a turn without waiting forever.
LOVE Twilight Imperium. Just can't get it to the table often enough.
Great game... Very complex
See my comments on TI3. This one seems a bit simpler but it’s the same core.
8 Players. Insert. Mata. Dodatek. 1400

Had a truly great time playing this game. I was put off by the notorious play time, that being said we played 6 players and all in all i think it was wrapped up 9 hours, with 2 of those being faffing about with set up.

This game is pretty perfect. It's always an event when we plan a TI day. The mechanics are meaty but they're intuitive and they don't bog down the gameplay. I'm not particularly good at the game but I rarely have this much fun obviously losing a game!

games.title: Spirit Island
games.description: Island Spirits join forces using elemental powers to defend their home from invaders.
comments:
Spirit Island
Branch & Claw
Jagged Earth
Horizons
Feather & Flame
https://spiritislandwiki.com/index.php?title=Main_Page

w/ official sleeves

A really great example of how to do a game well.

W/ all episodes and accessories.
Incredibly deep game with lots of replayability. Very thematic and aesthetically pleasing. Can't wait for the expansion!
Sokkal jobb, mint először gondoltam az egyik legjobb complex coop játék

Initial rating after a couple plays. Really solid thematic and cooperative game. Great depth and variety and I look forward to trying the various factions and the modules. Also have Branch and Claw added. All plays recorded here.
So much fun and so complex so many options that coop works cause it would take to much effort for someone to micro manage you.
Just one play, still finding, but surely I will believe I will rate it even higher.
My ability to play higher weight games appears to have diminished. I enjoyed it, but it’s definitely a “dedicated play session; preferably with a food break” game.
Storage Location: Pune
Play with my wife and brother many times, really good.

games.title: Brass: Lancashire
games.description: Test your economic mettle as you build and network in the Industrial Revolution.
comments: June 2024: an 8.5 rating for now. Might trend upward. A great game. Favorite thing is the “make your own” markets with the ports. Also love the two player map on the back. Least favorite thing is I wish there was a bit more variability at the starting board set up.
Sleeves. Upgraded tokens & resources. Iron Clays.
Birmingham are better. but I can see why some people like this version more. It more unforgiving.
Un jeu expert et exigeant dans lequel la thématique est forte et présente.

Deluxe Edition
+ Iron Clays
+ Sleeved Cards
+ 4x Player Aids
Cards sleeved. Includes Iron Clay poker chips.
For Trade/Sale! Missing Iron Clays. Includes 3d printed card holders.
Box has a tear on one of the corners

The canal to rail change in the middle of the game is jarring, but unlike any other game we have.  I stubbornly refuse to try the newer Brass because beer sounds silly as a currency to me.  Also, I read that this is a less forgiving design.
Probably should rate higher but Birmingham exists
Best economic abstraction I have played. Only game I've played like it. Everything is so carefully tuned.
Will always play Lancashire over Birmingham at 4 players.
Every turn matters. There is a lot of player interaction. The simple gameplay loop makes it so that the entire experience is about tight decision-making with no bloat.

games.title: Marvel Champions: The Card Game
games.description: Battle Marvel villains with unique teams of iconic heroes in this LCG.

games.title: The Search for Planet X
games.description: Plan, scan, and theorize to find a new planet at the edge of our solar system.

games.title: Gloomhaven
games.description: Vanquish monsters with strategic cardplay. Fulfill your quest to leave your legacy!
comments:
Gloomhaven
Forgotten Circles
Solo Scenarios
Envelope X
Great....but a lot of works!

LANG -- 2:30 Stunden -- Komplexität 3-
Okay @ 2-4 -- Good @ 2-4 -- Best @ 2-3
Letztes Spiel 02/2024

Card play and the feeling of progression is very addicting, and completely overtakes the cons for me. Drawbacks would be set-up/clean-up, a story that isn't necessarily bad, but very easily falls to the wayside besides very basic major points, and how tough it is to schedule sessions!

weight!upto4.0; expensive!;
massive! combining positioning progressive! fantastical unlocking poolbuilding theatrical thematic convincing surprising
Great game, but works beter digitally. Would never own the physical copy. That is what Jaws of the Lion is for.
I respect the ambition but ultimately it was not the right game for me or my group. Setup and tear down was just too much work. To the point that it turned me off from wanting to play.
Fantastic game! Still haven't finished the campaign and I'm not sure if I will. But I feel like I definitely got my money's worth out of it!
Fantastic and expansive game with fun card play, funny writing, and a lot of room for player expression. There's so much that's delightful in Gloomhaven!
there's too much going on here, i regret buying this.

DIFFICULTY: HARD

MARKED FOR AUCTION
[SHELVE] Played 40+ times. Have stripped it to use in Frosthaven
Since Der Ubermolch owned it, we didn't play my copy, so I sold it.
Would give a 10 if this game didn't take so much time to get to the table. Gameplay is great

games.title: Arkham Horror: The Card Game
games.description: Investigate the horrors of Arkham while courting cosmic doom.
comments:
---Campaign Expansions---
The Dunwich Legacy
Path to Carcosa

The Dunwich Legacy
Path to Carcosa

Harvey Walters

This was a bit of a let down and then I played the first cycle. Just read that if interested.

this game is haaaaard

it's like C: DMD without minis, but way harder
Everything outside of the core game and a few missions unplayed simply removed from clamshells and stored in card boxes.

Deck construction. Stella Clark. Jacqueline Fine. Nathaniel Cho, Winnifred Habbamock. Dunwich Legacy Campaign and Investigators. Edge of the Earth Investigators. Forgotten Age Campaign and Investigators. Casino Scenario pack
Every Adventure is an amazing event.
Nice game  excellent condition
Only played a part of a scenario. First impression is that this is a very clever designed, exciting game, with an excellent narrative.
Theme and tension in equal measure. Infinitely customisable, with hundreds of different stories to be told. Worth every penny of the high investment.

Very impressive how much story telling and immersion is done by simple cards. Creative tasks are waiting for you same as depth in deckbuilding / character arc. Just finished the starter campaign already, but still need to continue with the "Dunwich" one. Can't wait for it.

This game has hit the table pretty much non-stop for the last 2 and a half years. I have so many games sitting on my wall of shame because of this one. Yes, it is old, but it is still getting new campaigns released annually. It's community is alive and well.
Really enjoyed this.  Wife did not.  Do not want to spend the $$$ on collecting it.
bit too hard to get into and solo games are just hard to get into for me
+ Arkham Horror Kompendium II Ringbuch 475 Seiten

games.title: Root
games.description: Decide the fate of the forest as woodland factions fight for contrasting goals.

games.title: Orléans
games.description: Craftsmen, scholars & monks can help you reign supreme—but who will turn up to help?

games.title: The Quacks of Quedlinburg
games.description: Pull ingredients from your stock to make your pot bubble, but hopefully not explode!

games.title: Clans of Caledonia
games.description: Lead your unique Scottish clan to economic might via production, trade, and export.
comments: Tried with player counts: 3
Strategic, beautiful, excellent quality components. This is the best game I have played with a 'farming' theme. great depth to length ratio.
Good economic game, with some spacial elements.
Kickstarter - October 2017

This is a great money management game.  Your money helps your production, which you need to fulfill orders and spread out around the board. This is another game that just racks your brain with options trying to figure out what is the best action to take.  I always enjoy getting this to the table.
Prefer over Terra Mystica, but still feels long.

Great resource management game with a market manipulation element and unique clan abilities. An engaging solo experience that allows the player to learn the different faction abilities and feels tight.
Unofficial solo mode to try
I like the theme and production but components are not ideal - I wish sheep and cows and barrels and everything else have had more textures instead of formless blobs

Great game. It took what was good about Terra Mystica / Gaia Project and brought it to a "little farm" theme. The asymmetrical powers of the clans are fun to explore, and once you master the most complex part of the game — the issue of settlement scores — it becomes very tight and competitive.
Are the clans equal? It seems not. Not enough conflict and/or interaction with other players in a 2-player game. Basically an efficiency puzzle that you play as solitaire.

games.title: Paladins of the West Kingdom
games.description: Invaders are coming from everywhere.  Keep the faith and defend your homeland.

games.title: The Gallerist
games.description: Amass a fortune, and stake your reputation by operating a lucrative art gallery.

games.title: Kingdom Death: Monster
games.description: Try to survive in a nightmarish world that lies under eternal darkness.

games.title: Eclipse: New Dawn for the Galaxy
games.description: Build an interstellar civilization by exploration, research, conquest, and diplomacy.

games.title: Brass: Birmingham
games.description: Build networks, grow industries, and navigate the world of the Industrial Revolution.
comments: This game is the second best game in my collection.  BUT, Do not teach this to beginners, because there are many moving parts to the game.  Once the rules click in, it is super fun to play.
A good network building resource management game.
game can lead to frustration if player feels blocked out.
Great game 9/10 for personal preference, heavier for a lot of players

Really a perfect game. Sometimes I feel like I wish that there were more rounds, but the game is already fairly long so idk.

Iron Clay upgrade is possible.
Beautiful board game that is very fun to play.

Elegant and addictive. Feels streamlined despite the complexity. It's almost freaky how immersive this one is: once a game starts, my brain is incapable of thinking about anything else for a few hours.

Best 4 players
Players 2 - 4
64 x 89mm

+ Brass: Lancashire

The games is just fine. I wouldn't mind playing it but not going to seek it out. The card play is a bit wonky.

The Brass fan-boys are so obsessed with this game that they tank ratings of other games just to boost this one...sad.
Beautifully designed in systems, player interaction, and art.

Super solid, lots of interesting choices, and variety that makes subsequent plays feel novel and new.  I certainly agree with the overall view of the game, but I cant' help but feel like it's missing some magic that would make it *my* number one game.

games.title: Ark Nova
games.description: Plan and build a modern, scientifically managed zoo to support conservation projects.
comments: Sleeved w/ Ryker Sleeves

Spellenspektakel 2022
Materiaal compleet
Spel niet compleet, mist zoo map pack 2
Inclusief solo

Sleeves: 6,3 x 8,8 B.G
Fantastic blend of many interesting mechanics. Only downside is that it runs slightly long on the table.

This game is a masterpiece, holy moly. I'm very involved in my local zoo and this game, in addition to being a mechanically compelling euro, really perfectly captures the two-lane approaches that successful conservation organizations need to walk.

Exceptionnel, j'ai plein de problème sur les iconographies des cartes mercenaires. Mais, j'ai du mal à reprocher à un jeu qui cherche à pousser différents axes de gameplay de proposer des effets de cartes difficiles à comprendre.
It's a bit overrated. Player mats are cheap (playing card material).
Solo Play - Played twice...disappointed. The theme does not speak to me, I don't enjoy that game. Also not enough time to develop things in solo mode.
Okay game…too many mechanics meshed together. Does not flow for me.

games.title: War of the Ring: Second Edition
games.description: The Fellowship and the Free Peoples clash with Sauron over the fate of Middle-earth.
comments: 100% climate of the LOTR. I love this!
Traded Zombicide Season three for this.
An amazing game that is long and enduring but very hard to get to the table and quite complicated. If you can find the right person to invest the time, it can be an amazing adventure.

Includes:
War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth
War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth
A fascinating 2 player experience. Epic!
this is the best game I ever played!

Long and complicated war game that I just couldn't manage to get through. The game essentially being 2 players didn't help either. It might be a decent book emulator, but as a game we didn't find it very enjoyable.
One of the few games where I celebrate a loss like a win. When you say "Epic" - it is this game and Successors.
Complemento de adaptación segunda edición: B4
This game is designed extremely well, with every action involving a choice.
mindblown when i played this. I only had this feeling when i played that other "war" game i rated a ten(twilight struggle).
If you take the time to learn the rules, this game slaps, hard.
Bought together with Dennis

My favorite game of all time. My friend group has played over 15 games. So many great moments. Deep strategy. Games always leave me sitting in bed, replaying the game in my mind, imagining what I could have done differently.

games.title: Star Wars: Rebellion
games.description: Strike from your hidden base as the Rebels—or find and destroy it as the Empire.
comments: This is probably the best 2 player game I've played. I was the rebels and had a blast trying to hide from the empire. The game felt hopeless but felt like we turned the tide after blowing up the death star. Eventually our base was discovered and destroyed. Can't wait to play this one again!
Great game but kinda hard to teach and setup.
oh, this was epic fun, but long, not easy to table
Sleeved, Painted, Storage Complete, Need felt player boards
The rating is with the expansion (haven't tried it without).
great 2 player game for Peyton and I
The best Star Wars experience in a box. Hide & seek strategies, but so well done, thematically.
One of the best two player games ever made. Epic with a cinematic feeling! Unfortunately, due to the length of the game, it is rarely on the table...

shEEEEEEEEEEEEEEsh! This game is an epic. The list of positives about this 2-player hide-and-seek are long. The meh aspects fall on some of the units and war cards. These are fixed by the expansion. The only negative is the length. Clear your Saturday and don't have kids.
Возможно нужно улучшить качество коробки
Played one time and loved it. So Epic, so intuitive, so much to love! Lasted 6 hours or so and not a minute that i was bored. Exceptional game! Top 10 for me.

Fun tension and theme. You'll feel like you're defeated and then you'll feel like your gaining then you'll feel like you're losing etc.. It feels like you are playing as the rebellion or the Empire. Star Wars episodes 4-6 in a board game.

EPIC.
ook leuk als 2vs 2 maar je zit veel te fluisteren omdat je niet wil dat de tegenpartij je tactiek te horen komt.
Het is eigenlijk gewoon een 2 player spel.
Wel weerom wat randomness in de kaarten die je krijgt en of je je death star kan maken.

Bought 2017
First attempt to play sep 21
An exceptional game. If you like War of the Ring and you like Star Wars, you should buy this game.

Only play with Angus or kids
Oversized game
Solid game but not sure how often it will hit the table due to the length of the game.
Asymmetric hide and seek. Really impressive game for something that looks so overproduced. The combat is a little boring, but I hear the expansion fixes that.

games.title: Great Western Trail
games.description: Use strategic outposts and navigate danger as you herd your cattle to Kansas City.
comments:
Original Rating: 9.5

Solid well designed euro. Nice evolving board path. Pleasant interaction between players. Hits the table frequently.

Cooled a bit on this over the years, but still fun.
Classic for a reason. Great game!
Why is the train going west? And then straight into the ocean where someone scores points.
Great game with a lot of interesting decisions to make.

Great Western Trail
bgw

First of Pfister's rondel games with just a little bit of deck building and a fair bit of engine building. Variable ending still irks me since the game can be rushed but it's still a lot of fun, especially with the Rails to the North expansion!

Genre=euro
Players=2-4, b3
Timee=3h
Themes=western
Maracaibo is a far superior implementation of this game.
各种机制的融合怪，虽然很难去计算，但是玩着并不费劲。

What can be said that hasn't already been said?  GWT is top 20 for me.  I'll play it anytime.  I'm one who loves the expansion and prefers to play with it.  It loosens the game a little, adds some flexibility and creates new decision-making.  Great game!
Expansion/promos stored in base box.

*Owned by friend*
I have only played this game once. The game is well paced and there is a lot going on from cow selling, building better building, managing money and advancing your train. I get a sneaky suspicion my rating will increase when I have played it more. Looking forward to it.

Includes:
-Rails to the North Exp.

B1

Lots of mechanisms interweaved into a giant carpet: Rondell movement, Deckbuilding, worker placement, point salad ...
While this is exciting to dive into during the first couple of games I am not sure whether the overall design isn't overwrought.
I am still having fun, though.

games.title: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy
games.description: Build an interstellar civilization by exploration, research, conquest, and diplomacy.
comments: Great 4x game! So glad I backed this on Kickstarter.

Thought long and hard about this vs. TI 4e. Concluded the more-combat-less-diplomacy probably suits my playstyle better. Also encouraged by crazy all-in round-per-day solo idea I read about on the game's BGG forum.
like it maybe as much as TI4 cause it is less long
As good as the original. Just a bit more polished.
+ all-possible add-ons / expansions

+ Seekers
+ Outcasts

+ Rift Cannon
+ Minor Species
Random, quite long, but fun. Requires experienced players for smooth pacing play.
http://www.for2players.pl/2024/05/eclipse-second-dawn-for-ga...
Bought at Lauterpelit.fi in Helsinki

unlocking spreading combining convincing surprising fantastical stealing deductive collecting tactile;
A Game of Thrones: The Board Game favoured;
favoured over Twilight Imperium?, Xia?

games.title: 7 Wonders Duel
games.description: Science? Military? What will you draft to win this head-to-head version of 7 Wonders?
comments:
The best game there is for 2 players.
Cons:
A bit deterministic by the card piramid. You can know if you will win or lose some turns before the end, depending on who will get some card down the road, and you cant do anything to change that outcome.
The better version of 7 Wonders and a stable for any collection built to support two-player games.
Muy buen juego de a dos jugadores. [4]
Jeu de cartes simple et efficace qui ressort régulièrement, les parties sont assez courtes et on prend du plaisir
Très bon jeu, il me manque juste une forme d'excitation à y jouer. C'est assez froid dans le feeling de jeu.
One of the best 2P games available. Several victory paths (immediate or final scoring), easy to teach, short play time and tons of replayability.

Exp.: Agora; Pantheon
Upg.: Metal Coins; Metal Minerva Pawn
Cards: Messe Essen; Statue of Liberty;

This one is just good. It manages to get strategically deep without clogging a table, inundating you with rules or overstaying it's welcome.

Made better by the expansions (Agora more than Pantheon) as well!

+ Agora
+ Pantheon
10/10 with Pantheon or Agora expansions
For me it is one of the best two-player games.
Ich liebs ist ein tolles spiel
A cool rework of the original. Perhaps a bit calculable, but playing fast and loose helps me enjoy the tension of managing the opportunities out there.

2020
Materiaal compleet
Spel niet compleet, mist;

One of the best 2 players game around, and a great gateway game to start your board game collection/journey.

Simple good game. Especially for travel
W/ agora and Pantheon expansion

2024: need to table this game. Haven't got it to the table since boomeranging it. Might end up culling again in favor of the LotR version . . .

2022: This is my first boomerang game. Sold in 2020. Repurchased in 2022.
Love the draft mechanism and the fast, light pace combined with decisions that matter. Even better with Pantheon expansion.

Perfect
You can play it with both new players and pro players
If you are gamer or not you must buy this game and add it to your collection.
I was looking for a good, quick game for 2 players and I finally found it! Doesn't get boring after playing dozens of rounds.

games.title: Nemesis
games.description: Survive an alien-infested spaceship, but beware of other players and their agendas!
comments: 2024: underplayed, but good thematic game. needs to be tabled more. I likely need to cull either original or lockdown because this is not hitting the table enough to justify taking up as much shelf space as it does.
Random on random on random. Complete your objective and escape, but then you just lose a anyway to effectively a coin flip, after 4.5 hours. Not worth the time.
Fun, replayable, escalates quickly. Lots of minis to paint.

1 - Keep

Includes: Carnomorphs, Void Seeders, All Promos

a bit to much luck factor but i love it

update: after playing lockdown i rate it a 8 instead of a 9
AWESOME hidden role game with a STELLAR production.
This game is a blast to play! Can definitely see it's not for everybody but with my group it's a huge hit!
Too much randomness for me.
Truly a masterpiece of thematic gaming. Looking forward to whatever this team puts out next, would love to seem a slightly less convoluted or less punishing version because I am a filthy casual.
Pure fun. All parties I played were different and unpredictable.
We've talked about what went down after the games are over, sign of a good game
Multiplayer Games Best at Two - https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/339032/multiplayer-games-...
An epic game! Feels like participating in an action movie.
3 plays so far. good game. not keen on player elimination aspect and can be very random. player taking over the intruder is brutal.
Is good fun and exciting but difficult
This one is brutal. I love the pain, because it imprints the memories. I love the stories this creates. I may die, but you are dying with me. Really good one with a great table presence.

games.title: Great Western Trail: Second Edition
games.description: Wrangle your herd of cows across the Midwest prairie and deliver it to Kansas City.
comments:
+ Fantastic variability from game to game
+ The feeling of different strategies evolving from repeated plays is excellent
+ I love the theme and art in the 2nd edition
+ The components are nice
+ Deckbuilding component is limited but fits perfectly for this game
It's good. Not great, but good. I feel like this game is too easy to break.

Otro clásico renovado con una producción mejorada y con un par de cambios de balance en las reglas. Es un juego complejo y exigente que gusta mucho a los jugones en general. La temática es algo anecdótica pero resultona. Si queréis enfundar las cartas no os valdrá el inserto que trae.

Brettspiel (3.70)

75-150 Minuten

deck builder + engine builder

Played nephew's copy. He asked to play but then got here and said he didn't know how. However, we worked through it with only a couple hiccups. I aimed for getting lots of cowboys and cattle. Won handedly. Want to play again but still glad I didn't buy it.

Last played Q3 2022
Phantastisch! Tolle Umsetzung auch auf BGA!!!

games.title: On Mars

games.description: Serve guests and prepare rooms to be the best hotelier in the Viennese modern age.
comments:
(D&C own)
2-4 players

Rating after two plays. i liked this, it is tight. Played solo, the bot deck is very easy to manage but a nuisance (as it should). Can’t wait to play this with two.

Includes:
Grand Austria Hotel: Let's Waltz! (2021)
This is such a great game that pulls so many levers of gaming joy! There are so many factors to consider, yet, the mechanisms to employ those are so varied and enjoyable.

Extremely tight and crunchy, but looks and feels very sandboxy. So you just want to explore the game and in the blink of an eye, you're finishing round 4. Plays really fast and easy to explain. A keeper for sure!

Great game, easy to explain, tricky to master.Just love it! Great solo options as well, so far I played the simple solo variant and loved the game even more. Can not wait to try the other fanmade solo variant
Easy to learn but takes a while to get right. It's brilliant though!

A tight euro where every decision matters because of the limited number of turns. Great game overall.

Included:
Grand Austria Hotel: Let's Waltz!

games.title: Beyond the Sun
games.description: Collectively develop a tech tree to fuel new discoveries and colonize space.

games.title: Dominant Species
games.description: With an ice age approaching, which animals will best propagate, migrate, and adapt?
comments: een beetje lang, en te chaotisch.

Mentallly demanding strategy game with thorough player interaction in which you try to evolve your animal to survive the strikes from Mother Nature and other animals and ultimaltly become the survivor of the fittest! Magnificent theme, disruptive player interaction, demanding gaming experience!
price 60.99 amazon   ordered 8-4-18, first played 8-8-18,
Super gra. Interakcja nie była aż tak duża, jak się spodziewałem (ale się rozbestwiłem na grach typu Root), za to dynamika między gatunkami - mega.
A good game that I would recommend to most players. It offers a great experience and showcases high-quality mechanics and artwork.
Excellent multiplayer. Takes some time to play, but engaging with interrelated systems to manage creating strategic choices.

Difficult to learn and takes quite a while to play but some of the crunchiest and meaningful decision-making I've ever enjoyed in a game.  Also does a great job of making the mechanisms match the theme.

Pros:
- Wanderful mechanics

Cons:
- Too long to explain
- Too long to play
The token draw is way too impactful and way too random for what the rest of this game is. Does provide a fun avenue for some programming and multi-polar combat without too much agonizing negotiation.

games.title: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
games.description: Rewrite history as you build up your civilization in this epic card drafting game!
comments: Owned since July 2024 (29,99€)
It's incredibly clever I just don't find it fun

Sold. Game becomes a nightmare as soon as there are other players extremely aggressive. I do know it's part of the game and a key element of it. But getting Agressions from almost every opponent every other turn makes the game too harsh for my taste.
I just don't get what all the fuss is about.

I like this one very much. The biggest problem for me is the win condition. Culture!? Really? So my enormous army cannot do anything to my pathetic opponent, just because I was unlucky to not fetch any war card.
是個全方位都需兼顧的遊戲，並且對新手殘忍！不過的確好玩~
It takes several hours to play an entire game. Totally worth it anyway.
Vlaada made a miracle with this, the game has a very long duration but its like a time machine when you start to play
Preying on the weakest is a bummer. I won’t play with more than 1. Digital or 2 player only for us.

comments:
Expansions / Promos / Extras:
+ 2023 English Edition
Classic. Grandaddy of dudes on a map area control. Never a bad play. Simple ruleset with decent meat on the bone. Love this game. Will always play.
Area majority perfection. An evergreen design, and a game I will always say yes to.
What a smart and elegant design, with so much interaction on different levels, and a lot of fun to play. Reduced to the max, and very well aged! Take a bow.
Wanted to love it but after a few plays just couldn't get into it, felt.like an ok area control game to dry.
Was way more abstract than all the hype led me to believe.

on BGA, feels like a game I should own!
[update] and do!
Fun with Lots of interaction.
Very interactive - bluffing, secret choices, direct competition. Presumably better with more players. We have only played with 4 players - I am curious to try 5 players. Lots of fun!

+ Erweiterung
muss ich öfters spielen
Elegant area control game game. A classic! I like it.

Quite a good area control game. The combination of bidding for turn order and using those bids to take your actions on your turn reminds me of Cyclades. I'd say there's a smidge too much AP for me in this game, but I've only played once so the true depth may feel different in time.
Solo: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/480466/soloplay-variant-el-...
2023 edition. Not keen on the tuck boxes. the rest of the game looks great and plays well, even at 2 players. Strategy gets better with more plays.
This is a great game! I was sad to see the Big Box version of this game go.

Funny mechanics, but a lot of bad cards you never buy (cause they plug your deck) bring a big downside to the game. High luck-factor with timing at your reveal turn with Persuasion and the cards you can buy.

games.title: Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion
games.description: Vanquish monsters with strategic cardplay in a 25-scenario Gloomhaven campaign.
comments: Fantastic! Perfect entry into the Gloomhaven system.
I dont like playing cards and then having the enemies move away to make my cards useless, when cards are an important resource.
Help a lot passing long night thru the COVID pandemic...
First, I played three players: Hatchet, Red Guard, and Demolitionist. Then, I played solo with Red Guard and Hatchet.
This was ok to introduce new players to the world but I much prefer Gloomhaven/Frosthaven.
The most streamlined version of Gloomhaven. A perfect introduction or way to play a campaign without the need to commit the next several years of your life to your party.

[SHELVE] Flip book style maps are EXCELLENT for newbies and getting the game set up quickly. Love the way it walks you through the game.

*Complete- using the characters in Frosthaven*

Keep it to use for parts
I've played the full version, too. Excellent games, both, but the setup and complexity are higher than I usually want.

Amazing value at full price, but you can get it on sale or used.

Great introduction to the genre and to Gloomhaven. Every board game enthusiast should own JotL, even if it's just to introduce newcomers to Gloomhaven in a friendlier proposition.
Multiplayer Games Best at Two - https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/339032/multiplayer-games-...

Strategically use cards to explore rooms, fight monsters, and level up your characters in this 25-scenario campaign.

Theme: Dungeon crawling
Mechanism: Hand management
Winner: Meet condition (co-op)
Muy buen juego estratégico. Buen tutorial para ir incorporando reglas más complejas a medida que se va jugando. La experiencia de Gloomhaven pero en tamaño y duración de campaña más reducida
The game benefits greatly from an organizer insert. There are several STLs available for free in the usual places.
Nice dungeon crawl with tweaking and legacy mechanic.
Finished campaign - gave to Katie
super but I like the bigger versions
Having a blast so far just finishing tutorial missions.

games.title: Twilight Struggle
games.description: Relive the Cold War and rewrite history in an epic clash between the USA and USSR.
comments: • Incl. Mounted Board - $32
Classic CDG with lots of tough choices. Best played with people of roughly equal experience.
Game is a beast. I wish I got get it to the table more often but this is a challenging and long game. Hard to find someone willing make such commitment.
45 years of history in one box Easy to learn, hard to master ...
A solid game. But I much prefer War of the Ring
Great game but boy does it take longer than it should

2014: Partie non complétée faute de temps, après environ 3h30 de jeu. Intéressant. J'aimerais y rejouer.

2024-07: 10 ans plus tard, et 7 ans après l'avoir acquis, je n'y ai toujours pas rejoué. Je dois donc y attribuer une note inférieure à 6.
Better than Imperial Struggle

Amazing game. My first war game. The rules take a moment to click, but once they do the tactics are so interesting. Trying to figure out what to do when you're dealt your opponents cards is such a puzzle.
Random: The game. The card mechanic is VERY unfun. You don't have your events? Well too bad!.. jesus.

c'est moche, le thème ne sert à rien, mais bordel qu'est-ce que c'est bon !!!!  dans mon top 5
I'm no longer a dice hater, thanks Stefan.
A game with some great mechanics, but unfortunately brought down by the long set up and tear down between each round and by the very small and indistinguishable iconography on the hexes.
One of my favorite games, gifted his version upon getting the special edition.

Score < 0 means how many hexes weren't covered.
Score => 0 means which round was the final: the last one, the penultimate and so on.
Notre Dame or Macao should have this spot.  Still. Great game.

Compelling gameplay. The artwork on the original printing is bland AND garish AND completely uninspired. You have interesting moment to moment decisions. There are many options available but I like that the dice funnel you into a few possible choices.

games.title: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated
games.description: "Go forth, be bold, and ACQUIRE!" in this campaign version of "Clank!"
comments: Over-rated and tedious to play. I completed the campaign, but had to force through many plays. I lost interest in the gameplay and story after 3 plays. The deck-building is ok, but each game felt the same. I think it's a good game, but don't want to play any version of Clank.
21.7.22 bestellt bei Schwerkraft

Pure joy for as long as you're discovering new stuff; I expect this to not be quite as good once you're done with the campaign and don't have more secrets to uncover. But maybe that's not such a bad thing, because the experience of the campaign is so strong.

2-4 spelers
beste met 4
LEGACY GAME
The best Legacy experience on the market.

The best version of The Crew though 3 players still feels too easy and 5 players harder. 4 players ideal.
Was a fun game! Easy to pick up and play with anyone and can be as challenging or laid back as you want.
A fun trick playing game that requires a good bit of strategy! Would love to play it again!
Probably slightly more user-friendly than QfP9, but after a few plays, it doesn't feel significantly different.
One of the best card games I've played, marathoned the whole campaign.
Fun game, waiting for my son to get better at games before we marathon through the missions.
Good but difficult game. Have had many mixed opinions in my playing groups. Dislike the total lack of communication which can lead to long, boring stretches of play. Wish it was more fun to play.
Good.  But prefer the original.

Cooperative trick taking game where players are working together to achieve specific goals for each player. No quarterbacking.

Terrific, quick, fun game.
Aftermarket: Pintables By Caren board game insert
Is fun,  wonder about replayability though
Very good sequel to basic The Crew. Missions are more different and more interesting.

2-3p: 5/10
4p: 9/10

+Scales easily, easy to teach (start with fewer missions)
+Good mitigation options (reveals and SOS)
+Lots of interesting discussion on who can take what tasks

-2-3p experience are gimped versions (hide 1 card or simulate 3rd player)

Played for the first time with 3 players. Would likely be better with 4 but still a fun game. I pretty much enjoy any limited communication coop games, so this was right up my alley.  We only played through 9 missions so I definitely hope to play through all 32 at some point in the future.

Best game of 2021

Oh Cascadia! Lovely puzzle, played it solo and at two player.

Een heerlijk tegellegspel waarbij zowel de dieren als de plaatsing van de tegels belangrijk en goed in balans zijn. Vele varianten zijn inmiddels op dit spel gekomen, maar deze blijft toch het beste in zijn soort. Harmonies komt nog het dichtste hierbij in de buurt.
A good game. Not sure if the scoring is just 10% too baroque for a family game though. Splendor survives another 'killer'.
Very fun tile laying game, the angst of waiting to see if you can get a combo you want is exciting. Also love the Cascadia region so that helps.
A pretty zen game for me, but not much more. Little to no player interaction means that games start to feel same-y quickly, even with changing scoring rules.

Really good solo game. Chuffed to find and play this.

Not that easy to get right. It's got some pot luck in it and there does not seem to be a lot you can do about that. Except play it again !!

Waiting to write a full fledged comment on this one, first play didn't go so well, but want to give it another chance.

The classic Concordia is a masterpiece. Easy to learn, hard to master. A lot of indirect, positive interactions between players. The theme is a bit weaker or at least overused, but the masterfully done mechanics keep this game interesting and exciting forever.

games.description: Worlds await! Colonize, develop and conquer, taking advantage of others' choices.

games.title: Age of Innovation
games.description: Terraform the world to expand your faction and create innovations on the way.

games.title: Dune: Imperium – Uprising
games.description: Deploy agents, build your deck, and engage in strategic battles to control Arrakis.

games.title: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
games.description: Lead your civilization through strategic drafting of leaders, technologies, and more.

games.title: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
games.description: Work together — with friends or with Friday — to survive on a deserted island.

games.title: Kanban EV
games.description: EV-factory workers optimize and innovate to stand out at the big board meeting.

games.title: Cthulhu: Death May Die
games.description: Disrupt the ritual and slay the Elder Gods in this co-op dice chucker.

games.title: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine
games.description: Go on many planet-discovering space missions in this cooperative trick-taking game.

games.title: Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory
games.description: Simulate a whole contemporary nation in this asymmetric, politico-economic euro-game.

games.title: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon
games.description: Exploration, combat, and diplomacy in a dark Arthurian realm.
